snippet: Amid charges of being out of step with income inequality, former President Bill Clinton spoke out about the impact of policies like a welfare overhaul and the earned-income tax credit — a message his wife could use if she runs in 2016.
abstract: Former Pres Bill Clinton defends his economic legacy against charges of being out-of-step with income inequality, message Hillary Clinton could use if she runs for president in 2016; speech at Georgetown University reflects strategic effort by Clinton and his advisers to reclaim populist ground now occupied by ascendant left-leaning Democrats, and potentially to lay out economic platform that could propel his wife to the White House.
lead_paragraph: Amid charges of being out of step with income inequality, former President Bill Clinton spoke out about the impact of policies like a welfare overhaul and the earned-income tax credit — a message his wife could use if she runs in 2016.

headline.main: Bill Clinton Defends His Economic Legacy
